intro: Alona miersii, commonly known as the Miers' water flea, is a small aquatic crustacean belonging to the order Cladocera. It is typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. This species is characterized by its translucent exoskeleton and a distinct, segmented body structure. Alona miersii plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems as a primary consumer and a food source for various predators. Its presence is often used as an indicator of water quality and ecosystem health.
